page.title: 10MR.ASPIN
page.content: Mr. Aspin was headmaster of Elham School from 1959-1980. There were three classes in the old school, two in the main building and the infants in the Sir John Williams Hall. The dinners were eaten in the classrooms, having been cooked in the old Police House. The food was stored in the 'lock-up'. During snowy weather, two boys collected the dinners on a sledge. The new school was opened in 1970, by Mr. Haynes, the County Education Officer. It consisted of the kitchen and the junior classes. The Infant department was built in 1976. The new school was the result of Mr. Costain, the then M.P for Folkestone asking Parliament when Elham's new school was going to be built. Parliament didn't even know where Elham was, but promised to build within the year which they did.
